text: this may seem obvious but to make the
very best marmalade cake you really need
the very best marmalade trust me on this
one I know I have made marmalade cake so
many times with every kind of marmalade
out there and you know what the better
the marmalade that is the richer with
orange peel the more candied the better
the cake you can tell if you've got good
quality marmalade the second you open
the jar just take a look this is the
good stuff it's mostly peel dark color
rich flavor this one is the cheap stuff
and as you can see it's just a little
bit of peel floating in what is probably
mostly corn syrup it can be hard to find
so if you go to the supermarket go to
the international food section because
there you're gonna find good British
marmalade made from Seville oranges and
that's what you want so this is a butter
cake so obviously we have to have a lot
of good unsalted butter and then I'm
gonna cream it with just sugar I've got
some orange zest of course and then a
little lime zest just adds I always say
lime is floor also floral now you always
want to start slow so that you don't end
up beating this into your face once the
butter is fluffy and it looks kind of
like icing actually is what this looks
like you can add your eggs with one at a
time this is the place where you want to
make sure that you continue beating
until it's really smooth because once I
add the marmalade it's gonna look lumpy
and then I'm not gonna know if I have a
smooth batter or not add the marmalade
and some fresh orange juice you know in
England they always use self-rising
flour which is basically flour with salt
and baking powder mixed in but I mixed
it by hand because we don't use as much
self-rising flour here in the states
just until the flour disappears you
don't want to over beat it this is a
very well used pan so I know it's not
going to stick if I put enough butter
it's really good batter and now I'm
going to bake it at 350
so this is what the cake looks like when
it comes out of the oven it's
golden-brown it looks a lot like a pound
cake and in fact it tastes a lot like a
citrus pound cake of course I like an
icing with mine just because it
accentuates the marmalade enos of it so
I'm gonna do an icing with marmalade
confectioner sugar and a little butter
sea marmalade is practically glazed in
and of itself and then when you melt it
it becomes runny and then it's gonna
harden on the cake again see those big
pieces of Peel it's like eating a piece
of orange candy they're really good and
then just spread it all over the top
while it's still warm then it will
spread evenly and beautifully come on
candied orange once this stops dripping
I'm gonna give it a few minutes just to
let the icing kind of run down then I
can move it onto my serving plate oh
that looks really nice of course the
perfect accompaniment to a British
marmalade cake there's a spot of
afternoon tea but you know what
something stronger is good too
